original: @178a * // byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa'i shes rab le'u dang bsngo ba'i dka' 'grel bzhugs//
analyzed: @178a * // byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa'i shes rab le'u dang bsngo ba'i dka' 'grel bzhugs//
translated: Prajñā Chapter and the Dedication

original: # // da ni sems mnyam par gzhag pa'i gang zag des go 'phang khyad par can thob par bya ba'i don du shes rab bskyed par bya ba'i phyir le'u brgyad pa gsungs te /
analyzed: # // da ni sems mnyam par gzhag pa'i gang zag des go 'phang khyad par can thob par bya ba'i don du shes rab bskyed par bya ba'i phyir le'u brgyad pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to generate the prajñā of the person who has settled the mind in meditative equipoise for the purpose of attaining a special state, the eighth chapter is taught.

original: de la gang la brten te bskyed par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la gang la brten te bskyed par bya zhe na /
translated: In that regard, if it is asked on what basis is it generated,

original: bsam gtan gyi le'ur zhi gnas kyi tshogs la gnas te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi le'ur zhi gnas kyi tshogs la gnas te /
translated: it is generated based on the accumulations of śamatha in the chapter on dhyāna.

original: zhi gnas bsgom par bya ba nyid du bsdogs pa 'di dag thams cad kyang gang gi don du bsdogs she na /
analyzed: zhi gnas bsgom par bya ba nyid du bsdogs pa 'di dag thams cad kyang gang gi don du bsdogs she na /
translated: If it is asked for what purpose are all of these accumulations set forth,

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la bskyed pa'i don du bsdogs te /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la bskyed pa'i don du bsdogs te /
translated: they are set forth for the purpose of generating the continuum of self and other.

original: gong du bsam gtan bstan pa'i le'ur /
analyzed: gong du bsam gtan bstan pa'i le'ur /
translated: In the chapter on dhyāna above,🔽it is said, “Having understood that the afflictions are destroyed

original: zhi gnas rab tu ldan pa'i lhag mthong gis //🔽nyon mongs rnam par 'joms par shes byas nas //
analyzed: zhi gnas rab tu ldan pa'i lhag mthong gis //🔽nyon mongs rnam par 'joms par shes byas nas //
translated: by vipaśyanā endowed with śamatha,

original: thog ma zhi gnas btsal bya zhes de skad du bsdogs pa de bas na bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la mya ngan las 'das pa dang / bde ba 'dod pas de thob par bya ba'i don du shes rab bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thog ma zhi gnas btsal bya zhes de skad du bsdogs pa de bas na bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la mya ngan las 'das pa dang / bde ba 'dod pas de thob par bya ba'i don du shes rab bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since it is said that “one should first seek serenity,” therefore, in order to attain nirvana and happiness for oneself and others, one should generate wisdom.

original: de la mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi don te /
analyzed: de la mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi don te /
translated: Nirvana is one’s own aim.

original: bde ba ni gzhan gyi don to //
analyzed: bde ba ni gzhan gyi don to //
translated: Happiness is the aim of others.

original: yang mya ngan las 'das pa ni spangs pa'o //
analyzed: yang mya ngan las 'das pa ni spangs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, nirvana is abandonment.

original: bde ba ni ye shes so //
analyzed: bde ba ni ye shes so //
translated: Happiness is wisdom.

original: yang na mya ngan las 'das pa ni nges par legs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na mya ngan las 'das pa ni nges par legs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, nirvana is definite goodness.

original: bde ba ni mngon par mtho ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni mngon par mtho ba'o //
translated: Happiness is high rebirth.

original: de ltar bsam gtan dang ldan pa des mya ngan las 'das pa dang bde ba thob par bya ba'i don du shes rab gang bskyed par bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: de ltar bsam gtan dang ldan pa des mya ngan las 'das pa dang bde ba thob par bya ba'i don du shes rab gang bskyed par bya snyam pa la /
translated: Thus, in order to attain nirvana and happiness, one should generate wisdom.

original: don dam dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don dam dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In this regard, the verse “ultimate and conventional” and so on is stated.

original: 'dis ni yul bden pa gnyis la dmigs pa'i shes rab de bskyed par bya'o zhes bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni yul bden pa gnyis la dmigs pa'i shes rab de bskyed par bya'o zhes bstan te /
translated: This teaches that one should generate the wisdom that focuses on the two truths as objects.

original: bshad ces bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas so zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bshad ces bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas so zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: “Explained” means explained by the Tathāgata.

original: de dag gi so so'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: de dag gi so so'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin snyam pa la /
translated: What are their individual characteristics?

original: don dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽don dam blo yi spyod yul min //
analyzed: don dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / don dam blo yi spyod yul min //
translated: Ultimate, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The ultimate is not the domain of the intellect.

original: blo zhes bya ba ni mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi sgra'i yul ma yin par yang shes par bya ste /
analyzed: blo zhes bya ba ni mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi sgra'i yul ma yin par yang shes par bya ste /
translated: “Intellect” is merely an illustration; it should be understood that it is not even the domain of words.🔽As it says in a sūtra, “The ultimate truth is where the mind does not move, so what need is there to mention letters?”

original: ji skad du mdo las don dam pa'i bden pa ni gang la sems @178b rgyu ba yang med na yi ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes 'byung ba dang / yang lha'i bu don dam pa'i bden pa ni tha snyad thams cad las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las don dam pa'i bden pa ni gang la sems @178b rgyu ba yang med na yi ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes 'byung ba dang / yang lha'i bu don dam pa'i bden pa ni tha snyad thams cad las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: And, “Divine son, the ultimate truth is completely beyond all conventions.

original: ma skyes pa ma 'gags pa brjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / bral ba shes pa dang / shes par bya ba dang / bral ba'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: ma skyes pa ma 'gags pa brjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / bral ba shes pa dang / shes par bya ba dang / bral ba'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because it is said that the ultimate is unborn, unceasing, free from expression, free from what is expressed, free from cognition, and free from what is cognized.

original: /'on te de don dam pa de ji ltar blo'i spyod yul ma yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: /'on te de don dam pa de ji ltar blo'i spyod yul ma yin snyam pa la /
translated: But if you think, “How can the ultimate be the domain of the mind?”

original: don dam pa ni rigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du yin la /
analyzed: don dam pa ni rigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du yin la /
translated: The ultimate is just as it is.

original: rigs pas dpyad na dngos po gang yang ma grub ste /
analyzed: rigs pas dpyad na dngos po gang yang ma grub ste /
translated: When analyzed with reasoning, no entity is established.

original: ji skad du mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las /
translated: As it is said in a sutra:

original: blo yis rnam par gzhigs na ni //
analyzed: blo yis rnam par gzhigs na ni //
translated: When analyzed with the mind,

original: gzhan dbang med cing brtags pa'ang med //
analyzed: gzhan dbang med cing brtags pa'ang med //
translated: There is no dependent nature and no imputed nature.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis kyang /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis kyang /
translated: And Āryadeva also says:

original: gang ci brjod pa thams cad ni //
analyzed: gang ci brjod pa thams cad ni //
translated: Know that whatever is expressed

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong rig bya //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong rig bya //
translated: Is empty by its nature.

original: stong zhes bya ba de yang stong //
analyzed: stong zhes bya ba de yang stong //
translated: Even emptiness is empty.

original: 'di ltar mi stong yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar mi stong yod ma yin //
translated: Thus, there is nothing that is not empty.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / bden pa gnyis las kyang /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / bden pa gnyis las kyang /
translated: And in the Two Truths, it says:

original: de nyid phyir na de stong min //
analyzed: de nyid phyir na de stong min //
translated: Therefore, it is not empty.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas gang ltar yang ma grub pa'i phyir rigs pas dpyad na blo dang sgras ji ltar yang yul du byar med do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas gang ltar yang ma grub pa'i phyir rigs pas dpyad na blo dang sgras ji ltar yang yul du byar med do //
translated: Thus, when analyzed by reasoning, the object is not an object of the mind and words in any way.

original: yang na don dam pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la sgro btags pa'i spros pa rnam par chad pa tsam du zad pas /
analyzed: yang na don dam pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la sgro btags pa'i spros pa rnam par chad pa tsam du zad pas /
translated: Or, the so-called ultimate is merely the elimination of the superimposition of elaborations on the dependent characteristic.

original: de la ni blo dang sgras ji ltar yang yul du byar med de /
analyzed: de la ni blo dang sgras ji ltar yang yul du byar med de /
translated: Therefore, the mind and words do not make it an object in any way.

original: dgag pa tsam ni ci yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽de las bzlog pa blo dang sgra ni kun rdzob yin zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa bden pa gnyis bstan pa las /
analyzed: dgag pa tsam ni ci yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro // de las bzlog pa blo dang sgra ni kun rdzob yin zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa bden pa gnyis bstan pa las /
translated: Because a mere negation is nothing at all.🔽The opposite of that is that the mind and words are the conventional.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it says in the noble teaching of the two truths:

original: lha'i bu gal te don dam par ni don dam pa'i bden pa lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi yul gyi ngo bor gyur na ni don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu gal te don dam par ni don dam pa'i bden pa lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi yul gyi ngo bor gyur na ni don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su mi 'gro'o //
translated: “Divine son, if the ultimate truth were the object of the body, speech, and mind, it would not be called the ultimate truth.

original: de kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid kho nar 'gyur /
analyzed: de kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid kho nar 'gyur /
translated: It would be only the conventional truth.

original: lha'i bu don dam par na don dam pa'i bden pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i yul las kyang yang dag par 'das pa yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: lha'i bu don dam par na don dam pa'i bden pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i yul las kyang yang dag par 'das pa yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Devaputra, ultimately, ultimate truth is beyond the object of the exalted wisdom of omniscience, which is endowed with the most sublime of all aspects.🔽And the Sutra of the Teaching of Aksayamati says:

original: de kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is conventional truth?

original: ji snyed 'jig rten gyi tha snyad gdags pa dang / yi ge dang / skad dang / brdas bstan pa dag go zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: ji snyed 'jig rten gyi tha snyad gdags pa dang / yi ge dang / skad dang / brdas bstan pa dag go zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: It is whatever is taught by means of the designations of worldly conventions, letters, words, and expressions.

original: kun rdzob ni ji ltar snang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob ni ji ltar snang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The conventional is just as it appears.

original: zhib tu ni dbu ma'i bstan bcos gzhan dag las shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir @179a * //
analyzed: zhib tu ni dbu ma'i bstan bcos gzhan dag las shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir @179a * //
translated: This is to be understood in detail from other treatises on the middle way.

original: 'dir rgya ma bskyed do //
analyzed: 'dir rgya ma bskyed do //
translated: I have not expanded on it here.

original: da ni dngos po'i bdag nyid la log par rtog pa bsal ba'i sgo nas dngos po'i bdag nyid dpyad par bya ba mdor bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dngos po'i bdag nyid la log par rtog pa bsal ba'i sgo nas dngos po'i bdag nyid dpyad par bya ba mdor bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to briefly indicate the analysis of the nature of entities by way of eliminating misconceptions about the nature of entities, he says,

original: de la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: With regard to that,

original: dngos po'i bdag nyid bstan ma thag pa de la rnal 'byor ba dang / phal pa dang mthun pas phal pa ste mdo sde pa la sogs pa 'jig rten pa rnams kyis go rims bzhin du gnyis med pa'i tshul dang / gnyis kyi tshul du mthong ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i bdag nyid bstan ma thag pa de la rnal 'byor ba dang / phal pa dang mthun pas phal pa ste mdo sde pa la sogs pa 'jig rten pa rnams kyis go rims bzhin du gnyis med pa'i tshul dang / gnyis kyi tshul du mthong ste /
translated: with regard to the nature of entities that was just taught, yogis and ordinary beings are in agreement, so ordinary beings, that is, the worldly people such as the Sautrāntikas, see it in terms of the two modes, the nondual mode and the dual mode, respectively.

original: de la rnal 'byor spyod pa bas 'jig rten phal pa'i 'dod pa sun 'byin par byed cing 'jig rten phal pa las gong mar gyur pa rnal 'byor ba'i 'dod pa de ni de las kyang gong mar gyur pa dbu ma pa'i lta ba'i khyad par gyis sun 'byin
analyzed: de la rnal 'byor spyod pa bas 'jig rten phal pa'i 'dod pa sun 'byin par byed cing 'jig rten phal pa las gong mar gyur pa rnal 'byor ba'i 'dod pa de ni de las kyang gong mar gyur pa dbu ma pa'i lta ba'i khyad par gyis sun 'byin
translated: Therein, the Yogācāra refutes the assertions of ordinary worldly beings, and the assertions of yogis who are superior to ordinary worldly beings are refuted by the distinctive view of the Mādhyamikas who are superior to them.

original: par byed pas de'i phyir mtshan nyid la dpyad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: par byed pas de'i phyir mtshan nyid la dpyad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the nature of entities should be analyzed. This is the meaning.

original: da ni re zhig de nyid rgyas par bshad pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: da ni re zhig de nyid rgyas par bshad pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Now, from the perspective of explaining that in detail,

original: 'on te 'jig rten phal pa'i 'dod pa ni gang /
analyzed: 'on te 'jig rten phal pa'i 'dod pa ni gang /
translated: what is the assertion of ordinary worldly people?

original: de la rnal 'byor spyod pa pas ni ji ltar sun 'byin par byed ce na ;🔽'jig rten pa yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la rnal 'byor spyod pa pas ni ji ltar sun 'byin par byed ce na ; 'jig rten pa yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: How do Yogācāras refute that?🔽The root text says, “Ordinary worldly people . . .”

original: 'jig rten phal pa mdo sde pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten phal pa mdo sde pa la sogs pas so //
translated: Ordinary worldly people are Sautrāntikas and so on.

original: dngos mthong la zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: dngos mthong la zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la'o //
translated: “ Seeing things” refers to seeing forms and so on.

original: yang dag nyid du 'ang zhes bya ba ni ji ltar snang ba bzhin du phyi rol gyi don nyid yang dag par ro //
analyzed: yang dag nyid du 'ang zhes bya ba ni ji ltar snang ba bzhin du phyi rol gyi don nyid yang dag par ro //
translated: “ In reality” means that external objects are real in the way they appear.

original: sgyu ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de ltar snang ba'o //
translated: “ Like illusions” means that they appear in that way.

original: ji ltar rtsod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar rtsod ce na /
translated: How do they argue?

original: gzugs sogs zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzugs sogs zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text says, “Forms and so on . . .”

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught as follows.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni spros pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis mngon sum nyid du 'khrul nas de snang gi tshad mas grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni spros pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis mngon sum nyid du 'khrul nas de snang gi tshad mas grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Forms and so on are confused as if they were direct perceptions due to the ripening of the habitual tendencies of conceptual elaborations. They appear that way, but they are not established by valid knowledge.

original: de sgrub par byed pa'i rigs pa med pa'i phyir dang / gcig dang du ma la sogs pa'i tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de sgrub par byed pa'i rigs pa med pa'i phyir dang / gcig dang du ma la sogs pa'i tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no reasoning to establish that, and because it is undermined by valid cognition such as singularity and plurality.

original: dper na mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar 'dzin pa bzhin no zhes bstan pa yin no //🔽'on te de ltar na 'phags pa don rnam par nges pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs las gzugs gang zhe na /
analyzed: dper na mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar 'dzin pa bzhin no zhes bstan pa yin no // 'on te de ltar na 'phags pa don rnam par nges pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs las gzugs gang zhe na /
translated: For example, it is like apprehending the impure as pure.

original: gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /
translated: If you say, “In that case, it contradicts the scriptures, such as the noble Dharma discourse called the Differentiation of the Meanings, which states, ‘What is form?

original: de thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i lung dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: de thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i lung dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: Whatever is form is all four great elements and the form derived from the four great elements’?🔽”

original: 'jig rten gzud par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gzud par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “To guide the world,” and so on.

original: 'di skad du 'dul bar 'gyur ba'i skye bo dag gzud par bya ba'i ched du bstan pa yin gyi dngos su yod pa'i phyir bstan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du 'dul bar 'gyur ba'i skye bo dag gzud par bya ba'i ched du bstan pa yin gyi dngos su yod pa'i phyir bstan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: This is saying, “It is taught for the purpose of guiding those beings who are to be guided, but it is not taught because it actually exists.

original: des na 'gal @179b ba med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'gal @179b ba med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore there is no contradiction.”

original: ci de lta bu'i dpe mthong ngam zhe na /
analyzed: ci de lta bu'i dpe mthong ngam zhe na /
translated: Are such examples seen?

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The phrase “like an illusion” and so on is stated.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: As it is said in the Perfection of Wisdom:

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this.

original: dper na de bzhin gshegs pa shin tu zhi ba zhes bya bas lung bstan par bya ba'i sems can 'ga' yang ma gzigs nas sprul pa zhig sprul te /🔽mya ngan las 'das so //
analyzed: dper na de bzhin gshegs pa shin tu zhi ba zhes bya bas lung bstan par bya ba'i sems can 'ga' yang ma gzigs nas sprul pa zhig sprul te / mya ngan las 'das so //
translated: The Tathāgata called Very Peaceful did not see any sentient beings to be prophesied, and so he emanated an emanation.

original: de nas sprul pa des sangs rgyas kyi bya ba byas te /
analyzed: de nas sprul pa des sangs rgyas kyi bya ba byas te /
translated: Then that emanation performed the activities of a buddha,

original: byang chub sems dpa' dag bla na med pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dag bla na med pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan te /
translated: prophesied bodhisattvas to unsurpassed enlightenment,🔽and then attained parinirvāṇa.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur to zhes gsungs pa'i tshul gyis gdul bya'i rgyud la bsod nams bskyed pa'i phyir sprul pa'i sgyu ma lta bu bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur to zhes gsungs pa'i tshul gyis gdul bya'i rgyud la bsod nams bskyed pa'i phyir sprul pa'i sgyu ma lta bu bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: In the same way, in order to generate merit in the mindstreams of disciples, the Buddha taught like an illusory emanation.

original: de ltar 'jig rten phal pa'i 'dod pa rnal 'byor spyod pas ji ltar sun 'byin pa'i tshul bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten phal pa'i 'dod pa rnal 'byor spyod pas ji ltar sun 'byin pa'i tshul bstan nas /
translated: Having thus shown how the worldly person’s assertions are refuted by the Experientialists,

original: da ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i 'dod pa dbu mas ji ltar sun 'byin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i 'dod pa dbu mas ji ltar sun 'byin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to show how the Experientialists’ assertions are refuted by the Centrists,

original: gal te sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “If these so-called sentient beings,” etc.

original: gal te sems can zhes bya ba 'di dag kyang don dam par rang bzhin med pa yin na sgyu ma bzhin du shi ba'i rjes la yang mi skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba zhig na de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te sems can zhes bya ba 'di dag kyang don dam par rang bzhin med pa yin na sgyu ma bzhin du shi ba'i rjes la yang mi skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba zhig na de lta ma yin te /
translated: If these so-called sentient beings are ultimately without intrinsic reality, it would follow that, like an illusion, they would not be reborn after death. But that is not the case.

original: skye ba'i phyir don dam par yod do zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba'i phyir don dam par yod do zhe na /
translated: Because they are reborn, they must exist ultimately.

original: thams cad kun rdzob yin pas kun rdzob thams cad 'khor ba'i nges pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad kun rdzob yin pas kun rdzob thams cad 'khor ba'i nges pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since everything is superficial, there is no certainty that all the superficial is cyclic life.

original: rkyen rnams rgyus ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rkyen rnams rgyus ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “ All conditions are produced by causes,” etc.

original: gang gi tshe gnyen po ye shes ma skyes pas rgyu las dang nyon mongs pa ma log pa'i tshe ni 'bras bu sdug bsngal gyi phung po mi ldog ste 'khor bar yang yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gnyen po ye shes ma skyes pas rgyu las dang nyon mongs pa ma log pa'i tshe ni 'bras bu sdug bsngal gyi phung po mi ldog ste 'khor bar yang yin la /
translated: When the antidote, wisdom, has not arisen, and the causes, karma and afflictions, have not been reversed, the result, the mass of suffering, is not reversed.

original: gang gi tshe gnyen po skyes pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las dang nyon mongs pa 'gags te 'bras bu sdug bsngal gyi phung po mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gnyen po skyes pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las dang nyon mongs pa 'gags te 'bras bu sdug bsngal gyi phung po mi 'byung ste /
translated: When the antidote has arisen, the opposing factors, karma and afflictions, are stopped, and the result, the mass of suffering, does not occur.

original: mi 'khor bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe ni skye 'gag gi mtshan nyid kun rdzob yin yang 'khor ba ma yin pas nges pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi 'khor bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe ni skye 'gag gi mtshan nyid kun rdzob yin yang 'khor ba ma yin pas nges pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When that happens, it is not samsara. At that time, although the characteristics of arising and ceasing are conventional, they are not samsara. The meaning is that they are not indefinite.

original: yang rnal 'byor spyod pa dag na re /
analyzed: yang rnal 'byor spyod pa dag na re /
translated: Again, the Yogacaras say,

original: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: When, etc.🔽This is what they say:

original: 'di skad du khyod kyis gong du /
analyzed: 'di skad du khyod kyis gong du /
translated: You said above,

original: don dam blo yi spyod yul min //
analyzed: don dam blo yi spyod yul min //
translated: The ultimate is not the domain of the intellect.

original: blo dang sgra ni kun rdzob yin //
analyzed: blo dang sgra ni kun rdzob yin //
translated: The intellect and words are the conventional.

original: zhes smras pas don dam par sems nyid kyang ngo bo nyid med pa yin la /
analyzed: zhes smras pas don dam par sems nyid kyang ngo bo nyid med pa yin la /
translated: Thus, ultimately, mind itself is also essenceless.

original: yul ni ji ltar snang ba bzhin du yod do zhes khas blangs pa yin pas de'i dam bcas pa la phan tshun 'gal ba'i skyon chags te /
analyzed: yul ni ji ltar snang ba bzhin du yod do zhes khas blangs pa yin pas de'i dam bcas pa la phan tshun 'gal ba'i skyon chags te /
translated: Since you accept that objects exist as they appear, your thesis is flawed by mutual contradiction.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?🔽If consciousness itself does not exist ultimately, then what illusory object appears to consciousness?

original: gang gi tshe shes pa nyid kyang don dam par med pa yin na ni yul sgyu ma lta bu de shes pa gang la snang nas ji ltar snang ba @180a * //🔽nyid du yod /
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes pa nyid kyang don dam par med pa yin na ni yul sgyu ma lta bu de shes pa gang la snang nas ji ltar snang ba @180a * // nyid du yod /
translated: How could it exist as it appears?🔽But if the object exists as it appears, then the consciousness to which it appears also exists.

original: 'on te yul ji ltar snang ba bzhin du yod na de'i tshe gang la snang ba'i shes pa nyid kyang yod pas shes pa don dam par med pa nyid du mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yul ji ltar snang ba bzhin du yod na de'i tshe gang la snang ba'i shes pa nyid kyang yod pas shes pa don dam par med pa nyid du mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: Thus it is untenable that consciousness does not exist ultimately.

original: nyes pa 'di ni khyod la yang mtshungs so snyam nas /
analyzed: nyes pa 'di ni khyod la yang mtshungs so snyam nas /
translated: Since this fault is also similar for you,

original: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “When you say,” and so on.

original: khyed rnal 'byor spyod pa dag chos thams cad sems tsam nyid du khas len pa de'i tshe yul sgyu ma tsam yang med pa'i phyir shes pa don dam par yod par mi 'thad la gang gi tshe shes pa don dam par yod pa yin na ni /
analyzed: khyed rnal 'byor spyod pa dag chos thams cad sems tsam nyid du khas len pa de'i tshe yul sgyu ma tsam yang med pa'i phyir shes pa don dam par yod par mi 'thad la gang gi tshe shes pa don dam par yod pa yin na ni /
translated: You Yogācāras accept that all phenomena are mind only. At that time, since even an illusion-like object does not exist, it is untenable that consciousness exists ultimately. But if consciousness exists ultimately,

original: de'i tshe yul sgyu ma tsam yang med pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de'i tshe yul sgyu ma tsam yang med pa mi 'thad de /
translated: at that time it is untenable that even an illusion-like object does not exist,🔽because consciousness is said to be dependent on an object.

original: shes pa ni zhes bya ba la ltos pa yin pa'i phyir khyed la de yang ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa ni zhes bya ba la ltos pa yin pa'i phyir khyed la de yang ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate to you that this is uncertain,

original: ji srid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji srid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, “As long as there is consciousness, there is an object.”

original: dper na sgyu ma'i skyes bu yang rkyen tshogs pa'i dbang gis don dam par med kyang snga ma 'gags pa'i rjes la yang skye ba de bzhin du 'dir yang de dang 'dra bas skye ba'i phyir yang dag par yod ces bya ba de ni ma nges pa nyid
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma'i skyes bu yang rkyen tshogs pa'i dbang gis don dam par med kyang snga ma 'gags pa'i rjes la yang skye ba de bzhin du 'dir yang de dang 'dra bas skye ba'i phyir yang dag par yod ces bya ba de ni ma nges pa nyid
translated: For example, an illusory person, though ultimately nonexistent due to the power of the assembly of conditions, arises after the cessation of the previous moment. In the same way, since it arises, it is not certain that it exists in reality.

original: do snyam du bsams pa nyid do //
analyzed: do snyam du bsams pa nyid do //
translated: This is the thought.

original: 'o na de ltar don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa yin na /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa yin na /
translated: But if it is ultimately without entityness,

original: de'i tshe lo brgya 'am stong la sogs par yun ring du gnas par mi rung ba zhig na /
analyzed: de'i tshe lo brgya 'am stong la sogs par yun ring du gnas par mi rung ba zhig na /
translated: then it is not suitable to endure for a long time, for a hundred or a thousand years, and so on.

original: da ltar ni sems can zhes bya ba'i dngos po 'di yun ring du gnas pa nyid kyi phyir don dam par yod do zhe na /
analyzed: da ltar ni sems can zhes bya ba'i dngos po 'di yun ring du gnas pa nyid kyi phyir don dam par yod do zhe na /
translated: But since this thing called a sentient being endures for a long time, it exists ultimately.

original: de yang ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that this is also not certain,

original: rgyun ring tsam gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyun ring tsam gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, “By merely enduring for a long time . . .”

original: res 'ga' sgyu ma'i skyes bu la yang sman dang sngags la sogs pa'i stobs kyis yun ring du gnas pa srid pa'i phyir des na yun ring du gnas pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: res 'ga' sgyu ma'i skyes bu la yang sman dang sngags la sogs pa'i stobs kyis yun ring du gnas pa srid pa'i phyir des na yun ring du gnas pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Sometimes it is possible for an illusory person to endure for a long time through the power of medicine, mantra, and so on. Therefore, by merely enduring for a long time,

original: don dam par yod ces bya ba de yang ma nges pa'i skyon chags pa nyid do snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par yod ces bya ba de yang ma nges pa'i skyon chags pa nyid do snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: it is not certain that it exists ultimately.

original: 'on te de ltar rang bzhin med pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'on te de ltar rang bzhin med pa nyid yin na /
translated: But if it is ultimately without entityness,

original: sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin du srog bcad pas sdig pa mi 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ba zhig na sems can zhes bya ba'i dngos po 'di ni srog bcad pa las sdig pa 'byung ba'i phyir don dam par yod do zhe na /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin du srog bcad pas sdig pa mi 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ba zhig na sems can zhes bya ba'i dngos po 'di ni srog bcad pa las sdig pa 'byung ba'i phyir don dam par yod do zhe na /
translated: It follows that there would be no sin in killing a person who is like an illusory man, but this is not so, because sin arises from killing a sentient being. Therefore, this thing called a sentient being exists ultimately.

original: de yang ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir sgyu ma'i skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yang ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir sgyu ma'i skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To show that this is also not certain, he says, “An illusory man,” and so on.

original: 'di snyam du sdig pa 'byung ba'i phyir don dam par yod par ni ma nges kyi 'o na ce zhe na don dam par med kyang kun rdzob tu srog yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sdig pa 'byung ba'i phyir don dam par yod par ni ma nges kyi 'o na ce zhe na don dam par med kyang kun rdzob tu srog yod pa'i phyir /
translated: He thinks, “It is not certain that it exists ultimately because sin arises. Well then, although it does not exist ultimately, since life exists conventionally,

original: de bsad pa dang / ma bsad pa'i rgyus ci rigs par phan gnod 'byung ba yin pas de bas na de bsad pa'i rgyus @180b sdig pa 'byung ba yin zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de bsad pa dang / ma bsad pa'i rgyus ci rigs par phan gnod 'byung ba yin pas de bas na de bsad pa'i rgyus @180b sdig pa 'byung ba yin zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: it is appropriate that benefit and harm arise from killing it or not killing it. Therefore, sin arises from killing it.”

original: 'o na de ltar sems can rnams sems yod pa nyid kyi phyir don dam par yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar sems can rnams sems yod pa nyid kyi phyir don dam par yod pa yin gyi /
translated: Well then, since sentient beings have minds, they exist ultimately.

original: gal te don dam par med pa nyid yin na ni sems nyid kyang 'byung du mi rung ste /
analyzed: gal te don dam par med pa nyid yin na ni sems nyid kyang 'byung du mi rung ste /
translated: If it is the case that they do not exist ultimately, then mind itself is also unsuitable to arise,

original: dper na sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin no zhe na /
translated: like, for example, the son of a barren woman.

original: don dam par med kyang rkyen tshogs pa'i dbang gis kun rdzob tu 'byung ba mi 'gal te /
analyzed: don dam par med kyang rkyen tshogs pa'i dbang gis kun rdzob tu 'byung ba mi 'gal te /
translated: Even though they do not exist ultimately, it is not contradictory for them to arise conventionally through the power of the assembly of conditions.

original: dper na sgyu ma de nyid don dam par med kyang rkyen tshogs pa'i dbang gis rta dang glang po la sogs pa 'bras bu mi 'dra ba sna tshogs 'byung ba lta bu yin pas /🔽de bas na khyod kyi sems dang ldan par 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma de nyid don dam par med kyang rkyen tshogs pa'i dbang gis rta dang glang po la sogs pa 'bras bu mi 'dra ba sna tshogs 'byung ba lta bu yin pas / de bas na khyod kyi sems dang ldan par 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: For example, even though an illusion does not exist ultimately, through the power of the assembly of conditions, various different results, such as horses, elephants, and so on, arise.

original: don dam par yod ces bya ba de yang ma nges pa nyid do snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: don dam par yod ces bya ba de yang ma nges pa nyid do snyam du bsams nas /
translated: Therefore, since they arise in possession of mind, it is uncertain that they exist ultimately.

original: sngags la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sngags la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thinking that, he says, “Mantras and so on,” and so forth.

original: 'di skad bstan to //
analyzed: 'di skad bstan to //
translated: This is taught:

original: sgyu ma'i rgyu rkyen sngags la sogs pa la nus pa med pa'i phyir sems dang mi ldan par 'byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rgyu rkyen sngags la sogs pa la nus pa med pa'i phyir sems dang mi ldan par 'byung ba yin gyi /
translated: Since the causes and conditions of an illusion, such as mantras, and so on, are powerless, they arise without mind.

original: don dam par med pa'i phyir ni ma yin la sems can rnams la ni rgyu rkyen la nus pa yod pas sems dang ldan par 'byung ba yin gyi don dam par yod pa'i phyir ni 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par med pa'i phyir ni ma yin la sems can rnams la ni rgyu rkyen la nus pa yod pas sems dang ldan par 'byung ba yin gyi don dam par yod pa'i phyir ni 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: But it does not arise because of ultimate existence.

original: de bas na ma nges pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na ma nges pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is not definite.

original: 'on te sems can rnams la don dam par med kyang sems 'byung na ni de'i tshe khyad par med pa de bzhin du sgyu ma la yang ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sems can rnams la don dam par med kyang sems 'byung na ni de'i tshe khyad par med pa de bzhin du sgyu ma la yang ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhe na /
translated: But if minds arise in sentient beings even though they do not ultimately exist, then, since there is no difference, why do they not arise in illusions as well?

original: rgyu rkyen gyi nus pa mi 'dra ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu rkyen gyi nus pa mi 'dra ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the power of causes and conditions is different.

original: de bas na sna tshogs rkyen las zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de bas na sna tshogs rkyen las zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “From various conditions.

original: gal te rgyu rkyen gcig gis 'bras bu mtha' dag skyed nus pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te rgyu rkyen gcig gis 'bras bu mtha' dag skyed nus pa yin na ni /
translated: If a single cause and condition has the power to produce all effects,

original: de tshe sgyu ma la yang sems byung bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de tshe sgyu ma la yang sems byung bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then minds would arise in illusions as well.

original: de mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: But that is impossible.

original: gzhan gyis gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: gzhan gyis gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: Another says, “If the mind is not real,

original: spong lugs kyi don dam par ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin zhing bzlog nas kun rdzob ni 'khor ba nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: spong lugs kyi don dam par ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin zhing bzlog nas kun rdzob ni 'khor ba nyid ma yin nam /
translated: In terms of the mode of abandonment, nirvana is ultimate and samsara is the opposite, the conventional.

original: gang gi tshe khyed dbu ma pas ji skad bshad pa ltar don dam par ni skye 'gag thams cad dang bral ba yin zhing bzlog nas skye 'gag gi mtshan nyid thams cad ni kun rdzob yin par grub pa de lta na ni ;
analyzed: gang gi tshe khyed dbu ma pas ji skad bshad pa ltar don dam par ni skye 'gag thams cad dang bral ba yin zhing bzlog nas skye 'gag gi mtshan nyid thams cad ni kun rdzob yin par grub pa de lta na ni ;
translated: When you Madhyamikas establish that ultimately everything is free from arising and ceasing and that all things characterized by arising and ceasing are the opposite, the conventional,🔽then at that time even the Buddha would be samsara itself, since he is the conventional characterized by the arising of the antidote and the ceasing of the object to be relinquished.

original: de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyang gnyen po skye ba dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'gag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi kun rdzob yin pas 'khor ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir byang chub kyi spyod pa don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyang gnyen po skye ba dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'gag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi kun rdzob yin pas 'khor ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir byang chub kyi spyod pa don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the practice of the bodhisattva would be pointless.

original: nges pa med de skye 'gag phan tshun 'gag cing skyon 'di 'byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: nges pa med de skye 'gag phan tshun 'gag cing skyon 'di 'byung ba yin gyi /
translated: This is not certain. Arising and ceasing mutually cease and this fault does not arise.

original: gang gi tshe kho bo la ni shes @181a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe kho bo la ni shes @181a * //
translated: When for us

original: pa don dam par med kyang sgyu ma tsam du gnas pa de la yul sgyu ma de lta bu snang ba'i phyir nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: pa don dam par med kyang sgyu ma tsam du gnas pa de la yul sgyu ma de lta bu snang ba'i phyir nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that although the object does not exist ultimately, it is present as mere illusion, and because such an illusory object appears, there is no fault.

original: gzhan gyis phan tshun 'gal ba'i nyes pa de nyid las ma grol ba nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyis phan tshun 'gal ba'i nyes pa de nyid las ma grol ba nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that the opponent is not free from the fault of mutual contradiction,🔽it is said:

original: gang tshe sems nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang tshe sems nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: When mind itself appears as the diversity,🔽then what is the object and what is the mind?

original: de ltar yul dang sems gnyis ka sgyu ma nyid du khas len pa ni gnyi ga yang don dam par rang bzhin med pa'i phyir gang zhig gang la snang ste /
analyzed: de ltar yul dang sems gnyis ka sgyu ma nyid du khas len pa ni gnyi ga yang don dam par rang bzhin med pa'i phyir gang zhig gang la snang ste /
translated: Thus, the assertion that both the object and the mind are mere illusion is not tenable, because both are ultimately essenceless. Therefore, what appears to what?

original: de lta bas na yul ji ltar snang ba bzhin du yod pa shin tu yang mi 'thad pas phan tshun 'gal ba'i nyes pa so na gnas la /
analyzed: de lta bas na yul ji ltar snang ba bzhin du yod pa shin tu yang mi 'thad pas phan tshun 'gal ba'i nyes pa so na gnas la /
translated: Thus, it is completely untenable that the object exists as it appears. Therefore, the fault of mutual contradiction remains.

original: kho bo cag ni yul sgyu ma tsam 'di med kyang rang rig pa'i sgo nas shes pa nyid du khas len pas dam bcas pa la phan tshun 'gal ba'i nyes pa mi mtshungs so zhe na /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni yul sgyu ma tsam 'di med kyang rang rig pa'i sgo nas shes pa nyid du khas len pas dam bcas pa la phan tshun 'gal ba'i nyes pa mi mtshungs so zhe na /
translated: We do not accept that this mere illusory object does not exist, but that consciousness exists by way of reflexive awareness. Therefore, we do not have the fault of mutual dependence in our thesis.

original: slob dpon gyis nyes pa de nyid so na gnas par bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis nyes pa de nyid so na gnas par bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: To prove that the fault still remains, the master Āryadeva says:🔽The edge of a sword cannot cut itself,

original: ral gri so ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ral gri so ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and a finger cannot touch its own tip.

original: ji ltar ral gri so de nyid la bcad par bya ba dang / gcod par byed pa gnyis med pa'i phyir rang gis rang mi gcod pa bzhin du shes pa'i ngo bo de yang rig byed gnyis med pa'i phyir /🔽rang gis rang rig pa mi 'thad de /🔽de bas na yul khas mi len pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar ral gri so de nyid la bcad par bya ba dang / gcod par byed pa gnyis med pa'i phyir rang gis rang mi gcod pa bzhin du shes pa'i ngo bo de yang rig byed gnyis med pa'i phyir / rang gis rang rig pa mi 'thad de / de bas na yul khas mi len pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as the edge of a sword cannot cut itself because there is no cutting agent and object cut, in the same way, the entity of consciousness cannot be reflexive awareness because there is no object of awareness and awareness of that.🔽Therefore, it is untenable that consciousness is reflexive awareness.

original: shes pa don dam par yod pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i nyes pa so na gnas la /
analyzed: shes pa don dam par yod pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i nyes pa so na gnas la /
translated: Therefore, the fault that consciousness does not ultimately exist still remains.

original: gang gi sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba 'dis ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du thams cad du med pa'i don ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba 'dis ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du thams cad du med pa'i don ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The phrase “like an illusion” means that things are not nonexistent in every respect, like the horns of a rabbit.

original: snang du zin kyang don dam par med pa'i don yin pas /
analyzed: snang du zin kyang don dam par med pa'i don yin pas /
translated: Rather, it means that even though they appear, they do not exist ultimately.

original: de bas na yul dang shes pa gnyis ga don dam par med kyang snang tshod tsam du yod pa yin pa'i phyir yul sgyu ma lta bu de ji lta ba bzhin du yod pas nyes pa so na gnas pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na yul dang shes pa gnyis ga don dam par med kyang snang tshod tsam du yod pa yin pa'i phyir yul sgyu ma lta bu de ji lta ba bzhin du yod pas nyes pa so na gnas pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, although neither objects nor consciousness exist ultimately, they do exist in terms of what is apparent. Thus, since illusory objects exist in just that way, the error does not remain.

original: gzhan gyi shes pa gcig po de la rig bya dang / rig byed gnyis kyi bdag nyid ma grub kyang /
analyzed: gzhan gyi shes pa gcig po de la rig bya dang / rig byed gnyis kyi bdag nyid ma grub kyang /
translated: Although the single consciousness of another does not have the nature of both the object of knowledge and the knower,

original: rang rig pa nyid du gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid du gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir /
translated: it is established as self-awareness.

original: gal te mar me zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te mar me zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The opponent’s response to that is stated in the lines “If you say a butter lamp . . .”

original: ji ltar mar me rang gi ngo bo la rang gsal bar bya ba dang / gsal bar byed pa gnyis ma grub kyang /
analyzed: ji ltar mar me rang gi ngo bo la rang gsal bar bya ba dang / gsal bar byed pa gnyis ma grub kyang /
translated: Just as a butter lamp does not have the two aspects of illuminating itself and illuminating others,

original: gsal bar byed pa'i rkyen nyi ma la sogs pa gzhan la ma ltos par gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa'i rkyen nyi ma la sogs pa gzhan la ma ltos par gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is by nature clear, it does not depend on other conditions such as the sun in order to be clear.

original: rang gis rang gsal bar byed pa de bzhin du shes pa gsal ba yang rig par bya ba dang / rig par byed pa gnyis med kyang //
analyzed: rang gis rang gsal bar byed pa de bzhin du shes pa gsal ba yang rig par bya ba dang / rig par byed pa gnyis med kyang //
translated: In the same way, although the clear consciousness is not a duality of the object of awareness and the agent of awareness,🔽it is not dependent on another agent of awareness, because it is by nature aware.

original: rig @181b byed gzhan la mi ltos par rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir tshul gyis rang rig pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rig @181b byed gzhan la mi ltos par rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir tshul gyis rang rig pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is self-awareness.

original: yul sgyu ma tsam med du zin kyang /
analyzed: yul sgyu ma tsam med du zin kyang /
translated: Although the object is merely illusory and nonexistent,

original: shes pa don dam par yod pa 'gal ba med do zhe na /🔽slob dpon gyis dpe nyid ma grub pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: shes pa don dam par yod pa 'gal ba med do zhe na / slob dpon gyis dpe nyid ma grub pa'i sgo nas /
translated: there is no contradiction in consciousness ultimately existing.

original: de mi 'thad par bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de mi 'thad par bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: The master [Shāntarakṣita] refutes that with the argument that the example itself is not established.🔽In order to establish that it is not tenable, he says:

original: mar me gsal bar byed ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mar me gsal bar byed ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The butterlamp does not illuminate itself.

original: gal te de ltar mar me de gsal ba'i rang bzhin du khas len na ni /
analyzed: gal te de ltar mar me de gsal ba'i rang bzhin du khas len na ni /
translated: If one accepts that the butterlamp has the nature of clarity,

original: de'i tshe rang gis gsal bar byed ba shin tu yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de'i tshe rang gis gsal bar byed ba shin tu yang mi 'thad de /
translated: then it is utterly untenable that it illuminates itself.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang gis rang gsal bar bya mi dgos pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang gis rang gsal bar bya mi dgos pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it does not need to illuminate itself.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir mun pas bsgribs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mi gsal ba med pa la /
analyzed: gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir mun pas bsgribs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mi gsal ba med pa la /
translated: Because it has the nature of clarity, it is not unclear, which is characterized by being obscured by darkness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang gis rang gsal bar bya mi dgos pas rang gis rang gsal bar byed pa ma yin pa bzhin du /🔽'dir shes pa yang rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang gis rang gsal bar bya mi dgos pas rang gis rang gsal bar byed pa ma yin pa bzhin du / 'dir shes pa yang rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For that very reason, it does not need to illuminate itself, and therefore it does not illuminate itself.

original: ma rig pa'i cha shas med la /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i cha shas med la /
translated: In the same way, consciousness also does not have a part of ignorance because it has the nature of awareness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang gis rang rig par bya mi dgos pas rang gis rang rig par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang gis rang rig par bya mi dgos pas rang gis rang rig par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: For that very reason, it does not need to be aware of itself, and therefore it does not make itself aware.

original: de bas na rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it has the nature of awareness,

original: shes pa rang gis rang rig par byed do zhes bya ba'i khyod kyi gtan tshigs 'di la 'gal ba'i skyon chags pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa rang gis rang rig par byed do zhes bya ba'i khyod kyi gtan tshigs 'di la 'gal ba'i skyon chags pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the reason you state, “Consciousness makes itself aware because it has the nature of awareness,” is flawed because it is contradictory.

original: yan lag gi don brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: yan lag gi don brjod par bya ste /
translated: The subsidiary points will now be explained.

original: gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni rang gis rang gsal bar byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni rang gis rang gsal bar byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: “Illumination” means that it does not illuminate itself.

original: gsal bar bya mi dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal bar bya mi dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it does not need to be illuminated.

original: de nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar mun gyis bsgribs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mi gsal ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mun gyis bsgribs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mi gsal ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no non-illumination that has the characteristic of being obscured by darkness.

original: de gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it has the nature of illumination.

original: sngon po dag ni mthun pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: sngon po dag ni mthun pa'i dpe ste /
translated: Blue is a concordant example.

original: de bzhin du bee d'ur+ya bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bee d'ur+ya bzhin no //
translated: It is like lapis lazuli.

original: shel lta bu zhes bya ba ni sngon po de nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: shel lta bu zhes bya ba ni sngon po de nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i dpe ste /
translated: “Like crystal” is a discordant example.

original: ji ltar shel ni rang bzhin gyis sngon po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar shel ni rang bzhin gyis sngon po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because crystal is not blue by nature.

original: sngon por byed pa'i rkyen bee d'ur+ya la sogs pa la ltos pa yin la bee d'ur+ya sngon po nyid ni sngon po'i rgyu la mi ltos te /
analyzed: sngon por byed pa'i rkyen bee d'ur+ya la sogs pa la ltos pa yin la bee d'ur+ya sngon po nyid ni sngon po'i rgyu la mi ltos te /
translated: Blue is a condition that makes something blue, and it depends on conditions such as lapis lazuli. But the blueness of lapis lazuli does not depend on a cause of blueness.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dang po nas sngon po nyid du 'dug pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dang po nas sngon po nyid du 'dug pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it exists as blue from the beginning.

original: de lta bu'i bee d'ur+ya sngon po ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i bee d'ur+ya sngon po ste /
translated: Such a blue beryl

original: rang la rang gi sngon por byed de /
analyzed: rang la rang gi sngon por byed de /
translated: makes itself blue.

original: sngon por bya mi dgos pa'i phyir rang la sngon por mi byed pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sngon por bya mi dgos pa'i phyir rang la sngon por mi byed pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not necessary to make it blue, because it is not the case that it does not make itself blue. This is the meaning of the passage.

original: yang gzhan gyis shes pa rang rig pa'i bdag nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang gzhan gyis shes pa rang rig pa'i bdag nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to prove that consciousness is reflexive awareness,🔽the opponent says, “It is not tenable that consciousness is reflexive awareness, because it is not tenable that consciousness is the object of consciousness.

original: @182a * // rkyen gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: @182a * // rkyen gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “Other conditions” and so on.🔽

original: de ltar rang rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rang rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In this way, because it is reflexive awareness by nature,

original: rang rig par byed ces bya ba mi 'thad du zin kyang yul gzugs dang mig gi dbang po la sogs pa rkyen gzhan gyi stobs kyis shes pa de rang rig par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: rang rig par byed ces bya ba mi 'thad du zin kyang yul gzugs dang mig gi dbang po la sogs pa rkyen gzhan gyi stobs kyis shes pa de rang rig par byed do zhe na /
translated: it is not tenable to say that it makes itself reflexive awareness. However, by the power of other conditions, such as the object form and the eye faculty, that consciousness makes itself reflexive awareness.

original: khyed kyi lugs kyis chos thams cad sems tsam du 'dus pa yin pas /
analyzed: khyed kyi lugs kyis chos thams cad sems tsam du 'dus pa yin pas /
translated: In your system all phenomena are included in mind only.

original: sems las ma gtogs pa'i rkyen gzhan nyid ma grub pa'i phyir rkyen gzhan gyi stobs kyis kyang shes pa de rang rig par byed pa nyid du mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems las ma gtogs pa'i rkyen gzhan nyid ma grub pa'i phyir rkyen gzhan gyi stobs kyis kyang shes pa de rang rig par byed pa nyid du mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because conditions other than mind are not established, it is also untenable that consciousness is reflexive awareness due to the power of other conditions.🔽To demonstrate this, it says:

original: gzugs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gzugs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “Form” and so on.

original: de ltar gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'i sgo nas shes pa don dam par yod pa nyid mi 'thad par bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de ltar gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'i sgo nas shes pa don dam par yod pa nyid mi 'thad par bsgrubs nas /
translated: Thus, having established that it is untenable for consciousness to exist ultimately by means of a refuting valid cognition,

original: da ni shes pa don dam par yod pa la sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni shes pa don dam par yod pa la sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to demonstrate that there is no valid cognition that establishes consciousness as existing ultimately,

original: mar me zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mar me zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it says: “Lamp,” and so on.

original: mar me gsal bar byed pa yin par ni dbang po'i mngon sum gyi blos nyams su myong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mar me gsal bar byed pa yin par ni dbang po'i mngon sum gyi blos nyams su myong ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the mind of direct perception experiences that a lamp is what illuminates,

original: khas len par rigs na shes pa rang gis rang gsal bar byed pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma gang gis kyang ma grub pa'i phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis khas blang bar mi rigs so snyam du bsams pa ste /
analyzed: khas len par rigs na shes pa rang gis rang gsal bar byed pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma gang gis kyang ma grub pa'i phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis khas blang bar mi rigs so snyam du bsams pa ste /
translated: If it is proper to accept it, then it is not proper for those who have ideas to accept it, because the self-clarity of consciousness is not established by any valid knowledge of direct perception.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis khas len pa la ni sgrub par byed pa'i tshad mar khyab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis khas len pa la ni sgrub par byed pa'i tshad mar khyab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that whatever is accepted by those who have ideas is necessarily established by a valid knowledge that establishes it.

original: 'on te mngon sum ji ltar ma grub snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum ji ltar ma grub snyam pa la /
translated: If one thinks, “How is direct perception not established?”

original: re zhig yid dang dbang po'i mngon sum gyis ni mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: re zhig yid dang dbang po'i mngon sum gyis ni mi 'grub ste /
translated: First, it is not established by mental direct perception or sense direct perception,

original: de gnyis kyis yul ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa gzugs can gyi skye mched lnga yin pa'i phyir dang / rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis kyang mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis yul ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa gzugs can gyi skye mched lnga yin pa'i phyir dang / rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis kyang mi 'grub ste /
translated: because the objects of those two are the five physical sense bases, such as form and sound, and so on. It is also not established by reflexive awareness direct perception,

original: de nyid ni bzod dpyod pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir dang / rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum gyis kyang mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni bzod dpyod pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir dang / rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum gyis kyang mi 'grub ste /
translated: because that is the context of the analysis of the two, patience and investigation. It is also not established by the direct perception of a yogin,🔽because that is the context of the analysis of the two, patience and investigation.

original: tshu rol mthong ba rnams la rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum gyi tha snyad mi 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshu rol mthong ba rnams la rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum gyi tha snyad mi 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the term “direct perception of a yogi” is not applied to those who see only the near side.

original: de bas na rang gis rang gsal bar byed kyang rung mi byed kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de bas na rang gis rang gsal bar byed kyang rung mi byed kyang rung ste /
translated: Therefore, whether or not it illuminates itself,

original: mngon sum gyi tshad mas ma grub pa'i phyir dam bcas kyang mi 'grub po snyam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad mas ma grub pa'i phyir dam bcas kyang mi 'grub po snyam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: since it is not established by the valid cognition of direct perception, the thesis is not established. This is the meaning.

original: gal te mngon sum gyis ma grub kyang 'bras bu'i rtags la brten nas skyes pa rjes su dpag pas 'grub po snyam na /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyis ma grub kyang 'bras bu'i rtags la brten nas skyes pa rjes su dpag pas 'grub po snyam na /
translated: If you think that although it is not established by direct perception, it is established by inference, which is based on the evidence of effect,

original: gal te rang rig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te rang rig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then Nāgārjuna says, “If there is no autocognition called ‘experience’ . . .”

original: gal te bde ba la sogs par nyams su myong ba'i @182b rang rig pa med na phyis kyang dran pa skye ba'i rgyu rang rig pa zhig yod par rjes su dpag pas 'grub po snyam pa la /
analyzed: gal te bde ba la sogs par nyams su myong ba'i @182b rang rig pa med na phyis kyang dran pa skye ba'i rgyu rang rig pa zhig yod par rjes su dpag pas 'grub po snyam pa la /
translated: If there is no autocognition that experiences such things as pleasure, then you may think that inference establishes the existence of autocognition as the cause of memory.

original: don dran pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don dran pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, Nāgārjuna says, “If memory is of an object . . .”

original: dran pa'i shes pa skye ba'i sgo nas rang rig pa'i shes pa don dam pa zhig sgrub mi dgos te /
analyzed: dran pa'i shes pa skye ba'i sgo nas rang rig pa'i shes pa don dam pa zhig sgrub mi dgos te /
translated: It is not necessary to prove an ultimate reflexive awareness by way of the arising of a memory consciousness.

original: gong du ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis rang rig pa don dam pa de ni mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: gong du ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis rang rig pa don dam pa de ni mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Because, as explained above, that ultimate reflexive awareness is not established.

original: 'on te rang rig pa don dam pa de yod pa nyid du ma grub na phyis dran pa'i shes pa skye ba mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rang rig pa don dam pa de yod pa nyid du ma grub na phyis dran pa'i shes pa skye ba mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: But if that ultimate reflexive awareness is not established as existent, then it is not tenable that later a memory consciousness arises.

original: don dam pa med kyang rang rig pa kun rdzob tu yod pa'i dbang gis dran pa'i shes pa skye ba'i phyir de dran no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don dam pa med kyang rang rig pa kun rdzob tu yod pa'i dbang gis dran pa'i shes pa skye ba'i phyir de dran no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Although it does not exist ultimately, because reflexive awareness exists conventionally, a memory consciousness arises. Therefore it is said, “It is remembered.”

original: 'on te kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid du yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'on te kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid du yang mi 'thad de /
translated: But if it is not tenable that it exists even conventionally,

original: rang bzhin med par khas len pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin med par khas len pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: then it is not tenable that it exists ultimately because it is accepted that it is essenceless.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this, Candrakīrti says, “It is like this.”

original: mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs pa kun rdzob ni 'dir mi 'gog pa'i phyir dang / 'o na 'dir ci zhig 'gog snyam pa la /
analyzed: mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs pa kun rdzob ni 'dir mi 'gog pa'i phyir dang / 'o na 'dir ci zhig 'gog snyam pa la /
translated: Since seeing, hearing, etc., which are conventional, are not refuted here, one might wonder, “What is refuted here?”

original: 'dir ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dir ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, it says, “Here, however, . . .”

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal thams cad 'byung ba'i rgyu dngos por zhen pa dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal thams cad 'byung ba'i rgyu dngos por zhen pa dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Since this is the cause of all suffering, in order to refute the apprehension of things,

original: yang dag pa'i rang bzhin 'gog go snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rang bzhin 'gog go snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: it is the correct nature that is refuted.

original: da ni yul bden pa gnyis la dmigs pa'i stong pa nyid kyi phyir rnal 'byor bsgom par bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni yul bden pa gnyis la dmigs pa'i stong pa nyid kyi phyir rnal 'byor bsgom par bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach that the yogi/nī should meditate on emptiness because it is the object that is focused on the two truths,

original: sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa dri ba'i tshig bkod de /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa dri ba'i tshig bkod de /
translated: the question is posed, “How should one meditate on emptiness?”

original: gzhan dag 'di snyam du stong pa nyid du shes pa ni sgrib pa spong ba'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis bsgom par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag 'di snyam du stong pa nyid du shes pa ni sgrib pa spong ba'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis bsgom par mi bya ste /
translated: Others think that because the knowledge of emptiness is not the cause for the elimination of obscurations, it should not be meditated on by those who have conceptual thoughts,

original: dper na sgyu ma mkhan la sogs pa bzhin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma mkhan la sogs pa bzhin no snyam du sems na /
translated: just like the knowledge of illusionists, etc.

original: de byed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de byed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is stated in the lines beginning “The cause of that is . . .”

original: yongs su zhen pa 'byung ba'i rgyu ni gnyis te /
analyzed: yongs su zhen pa 'byung ba'i rgyu ni gnyis te /
translated: The cause of the arising of clinging is twofold:

original: nang gi tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ma spangs pa dang / phyi rol na rtag par bya ba'i yul nye bar gyur pa yin pa las /
analyzed: nang gi tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ma spangs pa dang / phyi rol na rtag par bya ba'i yul nye bar gyur pa yin pa las /
translated: the inner cause is not abandoning improper mental activity, and the outer cause is the presence of objects that are to be clung to.🔽Since the magician possesses both of these, it is reasonable that clinging arises when he is not investigating.

original: sgyu ma mkhan la ni de gnyi ga dang ldan pa'i phyir re zhig ma brtags pa'i tshe zhen pa skye ba ni rigs pa yin na gang gi tshe rnal 'byor ba chen po bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis bar du stong pa nyid la goms par byas
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan la ni de gnyi ga dang ldan pa'i phyir re zhig ma brtags pa'i tshe zhen pa skye ba ni rigs pa yin na gang gi tshe rnal 'byor ba chen po bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis bar du stong pa nyid la goms par byas
translated: But when the great yogi, who has become accustomed to emptiness for three incalculable eons,

original: pa ni dngos por zhen pa'i bag chags spong bas chos thams cad lag mthil du skyu ru ra'i 'bru bzhag pa bzhin du gzigs kyang zhen pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa mi 'byung bas de bas na sgrib pa spong ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir @183a *
analyzed: pa ni dngos por zhen pa'i bag chags spong bas chos thams cad lag mthil du skyu ru ra'i 'bru bzhag pa bzhin du gzigs kyang zhen pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa mi 'byung bas de bas na sgrib pa spong ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir @183a *
translated: has abandoned the latent propensities for clinging to things, he sees all phenomena as clearly as a myrobalan fruit in the palm of his hand, but he does not possess clinging. Therefore, since afflictions do not arise, he is not obscured.
