translated: How is the self not established?

original: re zhig gzugs bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: re zhig gzugs bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that form is not the self,🔽he says,

original: so dang skra sen zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽de dag ni bdag ma yin te /
analyzed: so dang skra sen zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / de dag ni bdag ma yin te /
translated: “Teeth, hair, and nails” and so on.🔽These are not the self.🔽

original: bdag dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir te /
translated: Teeth, hair, nails, and so on are not the self because they are not the same as the self.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How are they not the same?

original: so la sogs pa de dag ni mi rtag pa du ma yin pa'i phyir dang / bdag ni rtag pa gcig pu yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽gal te de dag bdag bzhin du rtag pa dang gcig pu nyid du 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: so la sogs pa de dag ni mi rtag pa du ma yin pa'i phyir dang / bdag ni rtag pa gcig pu yin pa'i phyir ro // gal te de dag bdag bzhin du rtag pa dang gcig pu nyid du 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: They are impermanent and multiple, while the self is permanent and single.

original: yang na ni bdag kyang mi rtag pa du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na ni bdag kyang mi rtag pa du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If they were the self, the self would be impermanent and multiple, or they would be permanent and single, like the self.

original: da ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, to show that the consciousness aggregate is not the self, it is said:

original: rnam kun du //🔽rnam shes drug ni bdag ma yin //
analyzed: rnam kun du // rnam shes drug ni bdag ma yin //
translated: In every way,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The six consciousnesses are not the self.

original: de dag ni yul gzugs la sogs pa rnams la so sor 'dzin pa yin la bdag ni thams cad la 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag ni yul gzugs la sogs pa rnams la so sor 'dzin pa yin la bdag ni thams cad la 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: The six consciousnesses are not the self because they apprehend objects such as form individually, while the self is the universal grasper.

original: de dag kyang bdag ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang bdag ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not the self.

original: gal te yin na ni de dag kyang bdag nyid du re res kyang yul thams cad 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: gal te yin na ni de dag kyang bdag nyid du re res kyang yul thams cad 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: If it were, then each of them would also apprehend all objects,

original: yang na ni bdag kyang de bzhin du yul re re la 'dzin gyi /🔽thams cad mi 'dzin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na ni bdag kyang de bzhin du yul re re la 'dzin gyi / thams cad mi 'dzin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: or else, like the self, the mind would apprehend each object but not all of them.

original: da ni yid bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni yid bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the mind is not the self, he says,

original: gal te yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If it were, then, like the self, the mind would be permanent.

original: yid ni 'gags ma thag pa yin pas /🔽da ltar med pa yin la /
analyzed: yid ni 'gags ma thag pa yin pas / da ltar med pa yin la /
translated: The mind is the immediately past state,

original: bdag ni rtag pa yin pas da ltar spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag ni rtag pa yin pas da ltar spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the self is the present state.

original: gal te yin na ni bdag bzhin yid kyang da ltar yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te yin na ni bdag bzhin yid kyang da ltar yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: If it were, then, like the self, the mind would be present.

original: yid kyi mtshan nyid nyams par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: yid kyi mtshan nyid nyams par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Therefore, the characteristic of the mind would be impaired,

original: yang na ni yid bzhin du bdag kyang da ltar med pas bdag gi mtshan nyid nyams par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na ni yid bzhin du bdag kyang da ltar med pas bdag gi mtshan nyid nyams par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or else, like the mind, the self would not be present. Therefore, the characteristic of the self would be impaired.

original: da ni ma 'ongs pa'i sems bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni ma 'ongs pa'i sems bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the future mind is not the self,

original: 'on te ma 'ongs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'on te ma 'ongs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “But if you say the future mind is the self, etc.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i sems ma byung bas da ltar med pa yin zhing /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i sems ma byung bas da ltar med pa yin zhing /
translated: ” The future mind, not having arisen, does not exist in the present.

original: bdag ni rtag pas da ltar yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag ni rtag pas da ltar yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the self is permanent and exists in the present.

original: gal te yin na ni ma 'ongs pa'i sems bzhin bdag kyang da ltar med @185a * //🔽par thal bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gal te yin na ni ma 'ongs pa'i sems bzhin bdag kyang da ltar med @185a * // par thal bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If it were, it would follow that, like the future mind, the self would not exist in the present.

original: yang na bdag bzhin du ma 'ongs pa'i sems da ltar yod pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na bdag bzhin du ma 'ongs pa'i sems da ltar yod pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, like the self, the future mind would exist in the present.

original: da ni da ltar ba'i sems bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni da ltar ba'i sems bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the present mind is not the self,

original: gal te bum sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te bum sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “But if you say the mind that now exists is the self, etc.

original: gal te da ltar gyi dus su bdag tu 'dzin pa'i sems de bdag yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te da ltar gyi dus su bdag tu 'dzin pa'i sems de bdag yin no zhe na /
translated: ” If you say that the mind that now exists, which is the apprehension of the self, is the self,

original: mi rung ste /
analyzed: mi rung ste /
translated: that is not correct.

original: de ni yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the object-possessor.

original: gal te yin na de bdag tu 'dzin pa'i sems yin par mi rung ste /
analyzed: gal te yin na de bdag tu 'dzin pa'i sems yin par mi rung ste /
translated: If it were, it would not be correct that it is the mind that apprehends the self.

original: yul gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yul gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is the entity of the object.

original: dper na bum pa yin na bum pa la 'dzin pa'i sems yin par mi rung ba bzhin nam bum pa la 'dzin pa'i sems yin na bum pa yin par mi rung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa yin na bum pa la 'dzin pa'i sems yin par mi rung ba bzhin nam bum pa la 'dzin pa'i sems yin na bum pa yin par mi rung ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, if it is a pot, it is not suitable to be the mind apprehending a pot. Or, if it is the mind apprehending a pot, it is not suitable to be a pot.

original: da ni 'das pa'i sems bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'das pa'i sems bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach that the past mind is not the self,

original: gal te byung sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te byung sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “If the so-called arisen mind . . .”

original: 'das pa'i sems ni 'gags nas med pa'i phyir dang / bdag ni rtag pa yin pas da ltar yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa'i sems ni 'gags nas med pa'i phyir dang / bdag ni rtag pa yin pas da ltar yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the past mind does not exist, having ceased, and because the self exists in the present, being permanent.

original: gal te yin na ni 'das pa'i sems bzhin du bdag kyang 'gags nas med par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gal te yin na ni 'das pa'i sems bzhin du bdag kyang 'gags nas med par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If that were so, then just like the past mind, the self would cease and not exist.

original: yang na ni bdag bzhin du 'das pa'i sems kyang da ltar yod pa nyid du 'gyur bas /
analyzed: yang na ni bdag bzhin du 'das pa'i sems kyang da ltar yod pa nyid du 'gyur bas /
translated: Or, just like the self, the past mind would exist in the present.

original: de gnyis kyi so so'i mtshan nyid nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi so so'i mtshan nyid nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the individual characteristics of those two would be impaired.

original: de ltar rnam par shes pa'i phung po bdag ma yin par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par shes pa'i phung po bdag ma yin par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught that the aggregate of consciousness is not the self,

original: da ni khams bco brgyad bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni khams bco brgyad bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the eighteen constituents are not the self,

original: gal te bdag mig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te bdag mig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “If the self were the eye, etc.”

original: mig gi khams ni gzugs la yongs su 'dzin gyi sgra la sogs pa gzhan yongs su mi gcod pa'i phyir dang / bdag ni thams cad 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gi khams ni gzugs la yongs su 'dzin gyi sgra la sogs pa gzhan yongs su mi gcod pa'i phyir dang / bdag ni thams cad 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the eye constituent apprehends form but does not apprehend sound, etc., and because the self is asserted to be the apprehender of all,

original: de ltar ma yin na mig gi khams bzhin du bdag gis kyang sgra mi thos par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na mig gi khams bzhin du bdag gis kyang sgra mi thos par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: if the self were the eye, it would not hear sound, etc.

original: yang na ni bdag bzhin du mig gi khams kyis kyang thams cad 'dzin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na ni bdag bzhin du mig gi khams kyis kyang thams cad 'dzin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, like the self, the eye constituent would apprehend all.

original: mig gi khams ji lta ba bzhin du mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba sgrub par byed pa'i rigs pa dang / so so'i mtshan nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mig gi khams ji lta ba bzhin du mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba sgrub par byed pa'i rigs pa dang / so so'i mtshan nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: The reason is that the self is not the eye because it has a different nature, and the consequence of the loss of its particular characteristic would follow.

original: 'gyur zhes bya ba bzlog pa gnod pa can gyi tshad mas ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'gyur zhes bya ba bzlog pa gnod pa can gyi tshad mas ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The words “would follow” should be applied as appropriate to the refutation by a valid cognition that contradicts the consequence.

original: da ni tshor ba dang 'du shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi phung po ste /
analyzed: da ni tshor ba dang 'du shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi phung po ste /
translated: Now, the aggregate of volition associated with feeling and ideation.

original: dngos su sems las byung ba @185b rnams bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos su sems las byung ba @185b rnams bdag ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the mental factors are not the self, he says:

original: de bzhin bde min zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin bde min zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Likewise, there is no pleasure, etc.

original: bde ba ni bde bar nyams su myong gi sdug bsngal la sogs par nyams su mi myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba ni bde bar nyams su myong gi sdug bsngal la sogs par nyams su mi myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because pleasure is experienced as pleasure and not as pain, etc.

original: tshor ba bde ba ni bdag ma yin te /🔽gal te yin na bdag bzhin du tshor ba bde bas kyang thams cad nyams su myong bar thal bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba ni bdag ma yin te / gal te yin na bdag bzhin du tshor ba bde bas kyang thams cad nyams su myong bar thal bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Pleasure is not the self,🔽because if it were, then just like the self, pleasure would be experienced in all circumstances.

original: yang na tshor ba bde ba bzhin du bdag gis kyang bde ba 'ba' zhig nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na tshor ba bde ba bzhin du bdag gis kyang bde ba 'ba' zhig nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, just like pleasure, the self would experience only pleasure.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal la sogs pa gzhan dag la ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal la sogs pa gzhan dag la ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: The same should be applied in a similar manner to the other feelings, such as pain.

original: da ni skabs kyi don gyi mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni skabs kyi don gyi mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to conclude the topic, he says:

original: de ltar bdag tu rung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ltar bdag tu rung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Thus, it says, “What is suitable as a self, etc.”

original: da ni mu stegs grangs can pas bdag sems pa yod pa'i bdag nyid du 'dod pa dang / bye brag gi sems pa med pa bdag nyid du 'dod pa de dag gnyi ga yang sems las ma gtogs pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir bdag nyid yin par mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i don du /
analyzed: da ni mu stegs grangs can pas bdag sems pa yod pa'i bdag nyid du 'dod pa dang / bye brag gi sems pa med pa bdag nyid du 'dod pa de dag gnyi ga yang sems las ma gtogs pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir bdag nyid yin par mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i don du /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that both the Sāṃkhya tīrthikas, who assert that the self is the nature of consciousness, and the Vaiśeṣika, who assert that the self is the nature of unconscious matter, are untenable because they accept that the self is not different from the mind, it says:

original: sems 'di nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sems 'di nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “This very mind” and so on.

original: da ni bdag grub tu zin kyang rtag pa nyid kyis na las dang 'bras bu ji ltar yang mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bdag grub tu zin kyang rtag pa nyid kyis na las dang 'bras bu ji ltar yang mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that even if the self were established, karma and its effects are untenable because it is permanent, it says:

original: lus la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “The body, etc.”

original: bdag med kyang dngos po mi rtag pa la las dang 'bras bu mi 'gal bar phyi rol dang nang gi dpe gnyis kyis go rims bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag med kyang dngos po mi rtag pa la las dang 'bras bu mi 'gal bar phyi rol dang nang gi dpe gnyis kyis go rims bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Even though there is no self, karma and its effects are not contradictory in impermanent things. This is demonstrated by two examples, one external and one internal, respectively.

original: sa bon la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / byis pa'i lus la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sa bon la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / byis pa'i lus la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The line in the seed and so on, and in the body of a child and so on, are stated.

original: da ni lus la sogs pa mi rtag pa yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni lus la sogs pa mi rtag pa yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach that the body and so on are impermanent,

original: mngal na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: mngal na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, in the womb and so on.

original: ji ltar mi rtag par 'gyur ba'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar mi rtag par 'gyur ba'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the way in which they are impermanent,

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //🔽de ltar ni ma grub kyi so so'i rgyud las skye zhing 'jig par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // de ltar ni ma grub kyi so so'i rgyud las skye zhing 'jig par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: he says, for example and so on.

original: de ltar sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ltar sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: That is not established. In order to teach that they arise and disintegrate in each continuum, he says, in that way, sentient beings and so on.

original: sems can med kyang snying rje bya ba mi 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can med kyang snying rje bya ba mi 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that it is not contradictory to practice compassion even though sentient beings do not exist,

original: gal te sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, even though sentient beings and so on.

original: dgos pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dgos pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The line for the sake of a purpose means

original: tha snyad gdags pa sla ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: tha snyad gdags pa sla ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it is easy to impute conventions.

original: skyes bu lha sbyin zhes bya bar tha snyad ma btags par /
analyzed: skyes bu lha sbyin zhes bya bar tha snyad ma btags par /
translated: Without imputing the convention person Devadatta,

original: gzugs dang tshor ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas @186a * //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas @186a * //
translated: because it would be difficult to designate form, feeling and so on,

original: tha snyad gdags dka' bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / 'jig rten pa dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: tha snyad gdags dka' bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / 'jig rten pa dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it would be inconsistent with the world and because it would be inconsistent with scripture.

original: 'jig rten la yang gang zag ces bya ba la sogs par grags kyi gzugs la sogs pa'i chos tsam du ma grags pa'i phyir dang lung dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir te ;
analyzed: 'jig rten la yang gang zag ces bya ba la sogs par grags kyi gzugs la sogs pa'i chos tsam du ma grags pa'i phyir dang lung dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir te ;
translated: The world is familiar with the term person and so on, but not with the mere phenomena of form and so on.🔽Also, scripture declares:

original: lung las kyang skyes bu gang zag 'di ni khams drug pa zhes bya ba la sogs par gsungs kyi /
analyzed: lung las kyang skyes bu gang zag 'di ni khams drug pa zhes bya ba la sogs par gsungs kyi /
translated: This person or sentient being possesses six elements and so on,🔽but it does not declare:

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ma gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ma gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This form and so on possesses six elements and so on.

original: skyon dang yon tan tshad gzung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: skyon dang yon tan tshad gzung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is necessary to measure faults and qualities.

original: skyes bu gang zag ces bya bar btags na de'i skyon la sogs tshad zin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: skyes bu gang zag ces bya bar btags na de'i skyon la sogs tshad zin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If one designated the mere collection of aggregates as the person, it would be necessary to measure its faults and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'di ni skyon 'di tsam dang ldan no zhes brjod na de'i tshad zin par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'di ni skyon 'di tsam dang ldan no zhes brjod na de'i tshad zin par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If you say that form and so on have only these faults, you will not have measured it.

original: ji ltar khyed la zhes bya ba ni khyed kyis sems can dang zhes bya ba la sogs par btags nas /
analyzed: ji ltar khyed la zhes bya ba ni khyed kyis sems can dang zhes bya ba la sogs par btags nas /
translated: Just as for you, you impute sentient beings and so on,

original: de snying rje skye ba bzhin du kho bo cag gi gzhung gis gong du bstan pa bzhin du dgos pa rnam pa bzhi'i dbang gis sems can zhes bya bar btags nas snying rje bya bar 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de snying rje skye ba bzhin du kho bo cag gi gzhung gis gong du bstan pa bzhin du dgos pa rnam pa bzhi'i dbang gis sems can zhes bya bar btags nas snying rje bya bar 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and just as compassion arises for them, likewise, in accordance with the four purposes taught above in our scriptures, we impute sentient beings and so on and it is not contradictory to have compassion for them.

original: de ltar ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis bdag ces bya ba ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis bdag ces bya ba ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since the so called self is not established in the manner just explained,

original: stong pa nyid du bsgoms pas 'jigs pa yang med la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid du bsgoms pas 'jigs pa yang med la /
translated: there is no fear of emptiness.

original: de bcings pa yang med cing grol bar bya ba'i phyir dge ba la brtson par bya ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bcings pa yang med cing grol bar bya ba'i phyir dge ba la brtson par bya ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Nor is there a bound self that is to be liberated, and so there is no need to strive for virtue.

original: bdag ma grub kyang bdag tu gzung ba'i gzhi sems de bcings pa las grol bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag ma grub kyang bdag tu gzung ba'i gzhi sems de bcings pa las grol bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Although the self does not exist, the mind, which is the basis for the conception of self, is bound and needs to be liberated.

original: dge ba la brtson par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i don du /
analyzed: dge ba la brtson par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i don du /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, although the self does not exist, one should strive to be virtuous in order to liberate the mind, the basis for the apprehension of self, from bondage,🔽the following verse is stated:

original: ji ltar chu shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar chu shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Just as the plantain, etc.

original: 'on te stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor de ji ltar bsgom par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor de ji ltar bsgom par bya zhe na /
translated: But how should one cultivate the yoga of emptiness?

original: de bsgom pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /🔽lus ni rkang pa byin pa min //
analyzed: de bsgom pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir / lus ni rkang pa byin pa min //
translated: In order to demonstrate the stages of cultivating that,🔽the following verse is stated:

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The body is not the feet, etc.

original: thog mar so sor rtog pa'i shes rab kyis lta ba bzhin du gtan la phab nas de'i rjes la gtan la phab pa'i don bsgom pa ni bsgom pa'i rim pa yin no //
analyzed: thog mar so sor rtog pa'i shes rab kyis lta ba bzhin du gtan la phab nas de'i rjes la gtan la phab pa'i don bsgom pa ni bsgom pa'i rim pa yin no //
translated: The stages of cultivation are as follows: first, one should ascertain the view in accordance with the wisdom of discernment. Then, one should cultivate the meaning that has been ascertained.

original: de ltar ma byas na nyes pa ci yod snyam pa la /
analyzed: de ltar ma byas na nyes pa ci yod snyam pa la /
translated: If one does not do it that way, what is the problem?

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid gtan la ma phebs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid gtan la ma phebs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the characteristics of things have not been ascertained,

original: de bsgom pa la 'jug par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de bsgom pa la 'jug par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: one will not engage in the cultivation of that.

original: zhugs kyang the tshom za bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: zhugs kyang the tshom za bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Even if one does engage in it, one will have doubts.

original: de ni sgrib pa spong ba'i gnyen por yang mi 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni sgrib pa spong ba'i gnyen por yang mi 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it would not be the antidote that eliminates the obscurations.

original: 'phags pa ting @186b nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las /
analyzed: 'phags pa ting @186b nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las /
translated: As the noble King of Samādhi Sūtra teaches,

original: ting 'dzin de ni bsgom pa byed mod kyi //
analyzed: ting 'dzin de ni bsgom pa byed mod kyi //
translated: “Although they cultivate that samādhi,

original: de ni bdag tu 'du shes 'jig mi byed //
analyzed: de ni bdag tu 'du shes 'jig mi byed //
translated: they do not destroy the conception of a self.

original: de ni nyon mongs phyir zhing rab 'khrugs te //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs phyir zhing rab 'khrugs te //
translated: They are disturbed by afflictions again and again,

original: lhag spyod 'di ni ting 'dzin sgom pa bzhin //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: lhag spyod 'di ni ting 'dzin sgom pa bzhin // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like Aṭhavahana cultivating samādhi.”

original: 'on te so sor rtog pa'i shes rab kyis gtan la phab nas bsgom na de'i tshe cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te so sor rtog pa'i shes rab kyis gtan la phab nas bsgom na de'i tshe cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you ask, “What happens if you cultivate samādhi without wisdom?”

original: thog ma sgom pa la 'jug par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: thog ma sgom pa la 'jug par 'gyur zhing /
translated: You will not enter into meditation in the first place.

original: zhugs nas the tshom mi za bar yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: zhugs nas the tshom mi za bar yang 'gyur la /
translated: And if you do enter into meditation, you will not be free of doubt.

original: sgrib pa spong ba'i gnyen por 'gyur ba'i sgo nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: sgrib pa spong ba'i gnyen por 'gyur ba'i sgo nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i yang phyir te /
translated: And it will not be the cause of nirvāṇa, because it will not be the antidote that eliminates the obscurations.

original: ji skad du mdo sde de nyid las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo sde de nyid las /
translated: As the same sūtra says,🔽If you discern the selflessness of phenomena and discern them individually,

original: gal te chos la bdag med so sor rtog / so sor de brtags gal te sgom pa ni //
analyzed: gal te chos la bdag med so sor rtog / so sor de brtags gal te sgom pa ni //
translated: and if you meditate on that,

original: de ni mya ngan 'das thob 'bras bu'i rgyu //
analyzed: de ni mya ngan 'das thob 'bras bu'i rgyu //
translated: That is the cause for attaining the result of nirvana.

original: rgyu gzhan gang yin des ni zhir mi 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan gang yin des ni zhir mi 'gyur // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Other causes do not lead to peace.

original: gal te de lta yin na de'i tshe gang la ji ltar brtag par bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na de'i tshe gang la ji ltar brtag par bya snyam pa la /
translated: If that is so, then at that time, on what should one reflect?

original: rgyal ba byams pas dbus mtha' las /
analyzed: rgyal ba byams pas dbus mtha' las /
translated: The Victor Maitreya says in the Discrimination of the middle and the extremes:

original: phyin ci log bzhi spang ba dang // bden pa bzhi la 'jug bya'i phyir //
analyzed: phyin ci log bzhi spang ba dang // bden pa bzhi la 'jug bya'i phyir //
translated: In order to abandon the four errors and to enter the four truths,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa zhes gsungs pas /
translated: one meditates on the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang chos la brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang chos la brtag par bya ste /
translated: Thus, one should reflect on the body, feelings, mind, and phenomena.

original: de la dang po lus la brtag pa'i dbang du byas nas lus ni rkang pa zhes bya ba ni lus zhes bya ba de rkang pa la sogs pa de nyid kyi ma yin la gzhan na yang med par bstan te /
analyzed: de la dang po lus la brtag pa'i dbang du byas nas lus ni rkang pa zhes bya ba ni lus zhes bya ba de rkang pa la sogs pa de nyid kyi ma yin la gzhan na yang med par bstan te /
translated: With regard to that, first, from the perspective of reflecting on the body, the body is not the feet and so on. This teaches that the so-called body is not the feet and so on and that it also does not exist elsewhere.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rkang pa la sogs pa de dag ni tha dad pas /
analyzed: rkang pa la sogs pa de dag ni tha dad pas /
translated: Those feet and so on are different.

original: du ma yin pa'i phyir dang / de las logs shig na dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: du ma yin pa'i phyir dang / de las logs shig na dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: because it is manifold, and because it is not observed as an observed object apart from that.

original: da ni yul zhes bya ba de yan lag rnams la cha shas kyis gnas sam bdag nyid thams cad kyis gnas brtag ste /
analyzed: da ni yul zhes bya ba de yan lag rnams la cha shas kyis gnas sam bdag nyid thams cad kyis gnas brtag ste /
translated: Now, in terms of the object, is it located in the parts by means of a part, or is it located by means of the whole?

original: de la phyogs dang po'i dbang du byas nas cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po'i dbang du byas nas cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In this regard, in order to demonstrate the consequence of having parts in terms of the first position,

original: gal te lus 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gal te lus 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “If this body” and so on.

original: phyogs gnyis pa ltar yin na ni /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa ltar yin na ni /
translated: If it is in terms of the second position,

original: lus de nyid mang po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus de nyid mang po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then the consequence of the body being manifold would follow. In order to demonstrate this,

original: lus ni lag sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: lus ni lag sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “The body would be many” and so on.

original: da ni lag pa la sogs pa'i nang dang phyi rol na yang med par bstan pa'i phyir /🔽lus ni lag sogs nang na gnas //
analyzed: da ni lag pa la sogs pa'i nang dang phyi rol na yang med par bstan pa'i phyir / lus ni lag sogs nang na gnas //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that it does not exist internally or externally in the hands and so on,

original: @187a * // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: @187a * // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “The body is not located in the hands and so on” and so forth.

original: cha shas med pas zhes bya ba ni lus gcig gi mtshan nyid de'o //
analyzed: cha shas med pas zhes bya ba ni lus gcig gi mtshan nyid de'o //
translated: “Because it has no parts” means that it has the characteristic of a single body.

original: cha can gyi nang du 'jug par zhes bya ba ni yan lag du ma'i nang du 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: cha can gyi nang du 'jug par zhes bya ba ni yan lag du ma'i nang du 'jug pa ste /
translated: “It cannot enter into the whole” means that it cannot enter into the many parts.

original: lus ni gcig yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lus ni gcig yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the body is one,

original: yan lag du ma'i nang du 'jug par mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: yan lag du ma'i nang du 'jug par mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: it cannot enter into the many parts.

original: /'on te de ltar lus med na lus kyi blo ji ltar 'byung snyam pa la /
analyzed: /'on te de ltar lus med na lus kyi blo ji ltar 'byung snyam pa la /
translated: If there is no body, how can there be the idea of a body?

original: de bas lus med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de bas lus med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, “The body does not exist. . . . ”

original: da ni yan lag rnams kyang ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni yan lag rnams kyang ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show that the parts are not established,

original: de bzhin sor mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de bzhin sor mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: it says, “Likewise, the fingers. . . . ”

original: da ni rdul phra rab ma grub kyang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rdul phra rab ma grub kyang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show that the subtle particle is not established,

original: phyogs cha zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phyogs cha zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it says, “The directions. . . . ”

original: cha med par zhes bya ba ni cha shas kyis gzhigs na med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cha med par zhes bya ba ni cha shas kyis gzhigs na med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Without parts” means that it does not exist when it is broken down into parts.

original: da ni rdul phra rab bsags pa ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rdul phra rab bsags pa ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show that the aggregation of subtle particles is not established,🔽it says, “The aggregation. . . . ”

original: rdul rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rdul rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The “aspect of atoms” and so on are mentioned.

original: de ltar lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i thabs bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i thabs bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the method of cultivating the mindfulness of the body,

original: da ni bsgom pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bsgom pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach the benefits of cultivation,

original: de ltar brtags na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar brtags na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “When one thus investigates,” and so on.

original: rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one abandons the afflictions such as attachment and aversion.

original: da ni tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i thabs kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: da ni tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i thabs kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: Now, in terms of the method of cultivating the mindfulness of feelings,

original: sems dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sems dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “The mind,” and so on.

original: 'di ni yul myong bar byed pa mi 'thad par bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni yul myong bar byed pa mi 'thad par bstan to //
translated: This teaches that it is untenable that the object is experienced.

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni rang nyams su myong bar byed pa nyid mi 'thad par bstan to //
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni rang nyams su myong bar byed pa nyid mi 'thad par bstan to //
translated: “By itself” teaches that it is untenable that it is experienced by itself.

original: gzhan gyis kyang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni myong bar bya ba nyid du mi 'thad par bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni myong bar bya ba nyid du mi 'thad par bstan to //
translated: “By another” and so on teaches that it is untenable that it is experienced by another.

original: de ltar tshor ba zhes bya ba myong ba'i ngo bo yin la /
analyzed: de ltar tshor ba zhes bya ba myong ba'i ngo bo yin la /
translated: Thus, what is called “feeling” has the nature of experience.

original: da ni myong bar byed pa dang / myong bar bya ba gnyis las gnyi ga mi 'thad par bstan to //
analyzed: da ni myong bar byed pa dang / myong bar bya ba gnyis las gnyi ga mi 'thad par bstan to //
translated: Now, it is shown that neither of the two, the experiencer and the experienced, is tenable.

original: da ni de ltar bsgoms pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de ltar bsgoms pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the benefit of such meditation,

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, “Thus, etc.”

original: tshor ba ni sred pa skye ba'i rten byed pa'i las can yin la /🔽de ltar bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba rang bzhin med par shes pas phrad pa'am bral ba'am /
analyzed: tshor ba ni sred pa skye ba'i rten byed pa'i las can yin la / de ltar bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba rang bzhin med par shes pas phrad pa'am bral ba'am /
translated: Feeling has the function of serving as the basis for the arising of craving.

original: rmongs pa'i sred pa mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rmongs pa'i sred pa mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By knowing that feelings such as pleasure are essenceless, the craving for contact or separation or for delusion does not arise. This is the meaning.

original: da ni sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the method of meditating on the application of mindfulness to mind,

original: yid ni dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yid ni dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, “The mind is not the sense faculties, etc.”

original: 'dis ni dbang po la sogs pa de dag @187b la yid ches bya ba de gsung du med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dis ni dbang po la sogs pa de dag @187b la yid ches bya ba de gsung du med pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, since that which is called “mind” is not those sense faculties, etc.,

original: mi gnas par rang bzhin med par ston te /
analyzed: mi gnas par rang bzhin med par ston te /
translated: it is shown that it is essenceless, in that it does not abide.

original: sems can zhes bya ba ni sems kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can zhes bya ba ni sems kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Sentient beings” means “of the mind.”

original: da ni ma skyes pas rang bzhin med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni ma skyes pas rang bzhin med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that because it is not produced, it is essenceless,

original: shes bya las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shes bya las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said: “If it is not simultaneous with the object of knowledge . . .”

original: ci'i phyir shes bya dus mnyam pa la dmigs te skyer mi rung snyam pa la shes bya'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir shes bya dus mnyam pa la dmigs te skyer mi rung snyam pa la shes bya'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Why is it not tenable for it to be produced by observing an object of knowledge that is simultaneous with it?

original: shes bya dus mnyam pa yod pa'i dus na shes pa de yod na shes bya dus mnyam pa des shes pa de la phan ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: shes bya dus mnyam pa yod pa'i dus na shes pa de yod na shes bya dus mnyam pa des shes pa de la phan ci zhig bya ste /
translated: If the object of knowledge that is simultaneous with it exists, then what benefit could the object of knowledge that is simultaneous with it provide to that consciousness?

original: shes pa ma skyes pa'i dus na ni shes bya nyid kyang med pa'i phyir gang gis phan byed /
analyzed: shes pa ma skyes pa'i dus na ni shes bya nyid kyang med pa'i phyir gang gis phan byed /
translated: When the consciousness is not yet produced, the object of knowledge itself does not exist. So what benefit could it provide?

original: gang gi tshe shes bya skyes pa'i dus de'i tshe na ni shes pa nyid kyang skyes pas phan bya mi dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes bya skyes pa'i dus de'i tshe na ni shes pa nyid kyang skyes pas phan bya mi dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When the object of knowledge is produced, at that time the consciousness itself is also produced. So it does not need anything to benefit it.

original: 'on te gang las kyang ma skyes kyang rang bzhin gyis gnas so snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te gang las kyang ma skyes kyang rang bzhin gyis gnas so snyam na /
translated: But if you think that although it is not produced from anything, it endures naturally,🔽then Nāgārjuna explains:

original: rang gis gnas pa 'gal med de //
analyzed: rang gis gnas pa 'gal med de //
translated: The abiding of itself is not contradictory.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of the absence of a cause.

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin //
translated: For example, like a sky flower.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: da ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i thabs kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: da ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i thabs kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: Now, from the perspective of the method of cultivating the application of mindfulness to phenomena,

original: rkyen rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rkyen rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, “Conditions” and so on.

original: rkyen so so ba las mi skye ste /
analyzed: rkyen so so ba las mi skye ste /
translated: It does not arise from individual conditions

original: sa bon la sogs pa re re las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa re re las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not arise from each, such as a seed.

original: 'dus pa las kyang mi skye ste /
analyzed: 'dus pa las kyang mi skye ste /
translated: It also does not arise from a collection

original: gang las mi skye ba de dag nyid 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang las mi skye ba de dag nyid 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not arise from those that do not arise.

original: 'o na gnyis po de las gzhan pa las skyes sam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gnyis po de las gzhan pa las skyes sam zhe na /
translated: Well, does it arise from something other than those two?

original: gzhan nas 'ong ba ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan nas 'ong ba ma yin la /
translated: It does not come from another.

original: de ltar ma skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar ma skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it does not arise in that way.

original: gnas pa med la 'gro ba med //
analyzed: gnas pa med la 'gro ba med //
translated: It does not abide and does not go.

original: ces smos so //
analyzed: ces smos so //
translated: This is stated.

original: 'o na 'jig rten pa rnams kyis ji ste bden par rtogs snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na 'jig rten pa rnams kyis ji ste bden par rtogs snyam pa la /
translated: Well, if it is asked, “How is it that worldly people realize it to be true?”

original: de ni 'khrul nas brtags pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ni 'khrul nas brtags pa'i phyir //
translated: It is said, “Because it is imagined through delusion.”

original: sgyu ma dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sgyu ma dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says like an illusion and so on.

original: da ni dngos po rnams la don dam par 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang bral bar bstan pa'i phyir sgyu mas sprul pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: da ni dngos po rnams la don dam par 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang bral bar bstan pa'i phyir sgyu mas sprul pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that ultimately things are devoid of going and coming, he says, like an emanation conjured by an illusionist. . . .🔽Now, in order to demonstrate that since things are not produced as either existent or nonexistent,

original: da ni dngos po rnams yod pa dang / med pa gang yang ma skyes pa'i phyir /🔽dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas dngos po yod pa nyid du mi 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dngos po rnams yod pa dang / med pa gang yang ma skyes pa'i phyir / dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas dngos po yod pa nyid du mi 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: they are not characterized by existence because they are characterized by nonexistence, he says,🔽If things were to exist . . . .🔽Now, in order to demonstrate that it is not the case that both are so, he says, If things were to exist . . .  and so on.
